intro: Streptanthus glandulosus subsp. glandulosus, commonly known as the glandular streptanthus, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. This subspecies is native to California and thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and produces pods that contain several seeds. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
